Parameter.Description: Determines how fast your copter reacts to an external interference along the roll axis. A higher value means faster reaction, but maybe also oscillation. A lower value means slower reaction, but may result in causing a too little effect.
Parameter.Name: Roll Proportional

Parameter.Description: This value takes account of the external interferences' duration and intensity along the roll axis.
Parameter.Name: Roll Integral

Parameter.Description: This parameter helps to get rid of a pendulum effect caused by external interferences along the roll axis. Decrease or increase until this effect is mostly gone.
Parameter.Name: Roll Derivative

Parameter.Description: Determines how fast your copter reacts to an external interference along the pitch axis. A higher value means faster reaction, but maybe also oscillation. A lower value means slower reaction, but may result in causing a too little effect.
Parameter.Name: Pitch Proportional

Parameter.Description: This value takes account of the external interferences' duration and intensity along the pitch axis.
Parameter.Name: Pitch Integral

Parameter.Description: This parameter helps to get rid of a pendulum effect caused by external interferences along the pitch axis. Decrease or increase until this effect is mostly gone.
Parameter.Name: Pitch Derivative

Parameter.Description: Determines how sensitive your copter reacts to angular movements. A higher value will result in a more agile flight characteristic.
Parameter.Name: Rotation Speed

Parameter.Description: Determines how fast your copter reacts to an external interference along the roll axis. A higher value means faster reaction, but maybe also oscillation. A lower value means slower reaction, but may result in causing a too little effect.
Parameter.Name: Roll Gyro Proportional

Parameter.Description: This value takes account of the external interferences' duration and intensity along the roll axis.
Parameter.Name: Roll Gyro Integral

Parameter.Description: This parameter helps to get rid of a pendulum effect caused by external interferences along the roll axis. Decrease or increase until this effect is mostly gone.
Parameter.Name: Roll Gyro Derivative

Parameter.Description: Determines how fast your copter reacts to an external interference along the pitch axis. A higher value means faster reaction, but maybe also oscillation. A lower value means slower reaction, but may result in causing a too little effect.
Parameter.Name: Pitch Gyro Proportional

Parameter.Description: This value takes account of the external interferences' duration and intensity along the pitch axis.
Parameter.Name: Pitch Gyro Integral

Parameter.Description: This parameter helps to get rid of a pendulum effect caused by external interferences along the pitch axis. Decrease or increase until this effect is mostly gone.
Parameter.Name: Pitch Gyro Derivative

Parameter.Description: Determines how fast your copter reacts to an external interference along the yaw axis. A higher value means faster reaction, but maybe also oscillation. A lower value means slower reaction, but may result in causing a too little effect.
Parameter.Name: Yaw Proportional

Parameter.Description: This value takes account of the external interferences' duration and intensity along the yaw axis.
Parameter.Name: Yaw Integral

Parameter.Description: This parameter helps to get rid of a pendulum effect caused by external interferences along the yaw axis. Decrease or increase until this effect is mostly gone.
Parameter.Name: Yaw Derivative

Parameter.Description: Determines how fast your copter reacts to changes in heading which are not caues by pilot input (e.g. wind). A higher value means faster reaction, but maybe also oscillation. A lower value means slower reaction, but may result in causing a too little effect.
Parameter.Name: Heading Hold Proportional

Parameter.Description: This value takes account of the heading changes' duration and intensity.
Parameter.Name: Heading Hold Integral

Parameter.Description: This parameter helps to get rid of a pendulum effect caused by the Heading Hold feature. Decrease or increase until this effect is mostly gone.
Parameter.Name: Heading Hold Derivative

Parameter.Description: Controls the state of the Heading Hold feature: 1 = Enabled, 0 = Disabled
Parameter.Name: Heading Hold Configuration

Parameter.Description: Determines how fast your copter reacts to a change in altitude. A higher value means faster reaction, but maybe also oscillation. A lower value means slower reaction, but may result in causing a too little effect.
Parameter.Name: Barometer Altitude Proportional

Parameter.Description: This value takes account of the change's duration and intensity.
Parameter.Name: Barometer Altitude Integral

Parameter.Description: This parameter helps to get rid of a pendulum effect meaning your copter is moving up und down around the desired altitude. Decrease or increase until this effect is mostly gone.
Parameter.Name: Barometer Altitude Derivative

Parameter.Description: Declares the needed amount of increase/decrease in the throttle value (relatively to the value when Altitude Hold was enabled) to cause the altitude setpoint to be increased/decreased.
Parameter.Name: Throttle Bump Value

Parameter.Description: Declares the needed amount of increase/decrease in the throttle value (relatively to the value when Altitude Hold was enabled) to immediately turn Altitude Hold off.
Parameter.Name: Throttle Panic Value

Parameter.Description: Declares the maximum amount of allowed positive throttle change to prevent unexpected throttle changes. Must be a positive value.
Parameter.Name: Maximum Throttle Adjust

Parameter.Description: Declares the maximum amount of allowed negative throttle change to prevent unexpected throttle changes. Must be a negative value.
Parameter.Name: Minimum Throttle Adjust

Parameter.Description: Used to smooth spikes in the measured altitude value.
Parameter.Name: Altitude Smooth Factor

Parameter.Description: Not used at the moment.
Parameter.Name: Z-Dampening Proportional

Parameter.Description: Not used at the moment.
Parameter.Name: Z-Dampening Integral

Parameter.Description: Not used at the moment.
Parameter.Name: Z-Dampening Derivative

Parameter.Description: Defines how all received transmitter values are scaled. A factor of 1 means the values are processed as received without modification.
Parameter.Name: Transmitter Factor

Parameter.Description: Defines how the received Roll value is scaled. A factor of 1 means the value is processed as received without modification.
Parameter.Name: Roll Smoothing

Parameter.Description: Defines how the received Pitch value is scaled. A factor of 1 means the value is processed as received without modification.
Parameter.Name: Pitch Smoothing

Parameter.Description: Defines how the received Yaw value is scaled. A factor of 1 means the value is processed as received without modification.
Parameter.Name: Yaw Smoothing

Parameter.Description: Defines how the received Throttle value is scaled. A factor of 1 means the value is processed as received without modification.
Parameter.Name: Throttle Smoothing

Parameter.Description: Defines how the received Mode value is scaled. A factor of 1 means the value is processed as received without modification.
Parameter.Name: Mode Smoothing

Parameter.Description: Defines how the received AUX1 value is scaled. A factor of 1 means the value is processed as received without modification.
Parameter.Name: AUX1 Smoothing

Parameter.Description: Defines how the received AUX2 value is scaled. A factor of 1 means the value is processed as received without modification.
Parameter.Name: AUX2 Smoothing

Parameter.Description: Defines how the received AUX3 value is scaled. A factor of 1 means the value is processed as received without modification.
Parameter.Name: AUX3 Smoothing

Parameter.Description: Defines how the received AUX4 value is scaled. A factor of 1 means the value is processed as received without modification.
Parameter.Name: AUX4 Smoothing

Parameter.Description: Defines how the received AUX5 value is scaled. A factor of 1 means the value is processed as received without modification.
Parameter.Name: AUX5 Smoothing

Parameter.Description: Defines the voltage value (per cell) when battery alarm (second level) is triggered. The battery warning (first level) is 110% of this value (e.g. alarm = 3.3 means warning = 3.63).
Parameter.Name: Alarm Voltage

Parameter.Description: Only needed if BatteryMonitorAutoDescend is enabled in the software. Used to initiate an automatical descent of your copter once battery alarm is hit. Defines the target throttle value which you want to reach.
Parameter.Name: Throttle Target

Parameter.Description: Only needed if BatteryMonitorAutoDescend is enabled in the software. Defines the time (in milliseconds) in which you want to reach the target throttle value set above.
Parameter.Name: Going Down Time

Parameter.Description: Controls the state of the camera stabilization feature. 0 = disabled, 1 = enabled
Parameter.Name: Mode

Parameter.Description: Sets the center position for pitch servo.
Parameter.Name: Center Pitch

Parameter.Description: Sets the center position for roll servo.
Parameter.Name: Center Roll

Parameter.Description: Sets the center position for yaw servo.
Parameter.Name: Center Yaw

Parameter.Description: Sets the speed how fast the pitch servo will respond to changes in pitch angle (negative numbers will reverse servo direction).
Parameter.Name: Scale Pitch Angle

Parameter.Description: Sets the speed how fast the roll servo will respond to changes in roll angle (negative numbers will reverse servo direction).
Parameter.Name: Scale Roll Angle

Parameter.Description: Sets the speed how fast the yaw servo will respond to changes in yaw angle (negative numbers will reverse servo direction).
Parameter.Name: Scale Yaw Angle

Parameter.Description: Sets the minimum position of the pitch servo.
Parameter.Name: Servo Minimum Pitch

Parameter.Description: Sets the minimum position of the roll servo.
Parameter.Name: Servo Minimum Roll

Parameter.Description: Sets the minimum position of the yaw servo.
Parameter.Name: Servo Minimum Yaw

Parameter.Description: Sets the maximum position of the pitch servo.
Parameter.Name: Servo Maximum Pitch

Parameter.Description: Sets the maximum position of the roll servo.
Parameter.Name: Servo Maximum Roll

Parameter.Description: Sets the maximum position of the yaw servo.
Parameter.Name: Servo Maximum Yaw

Parameter.Description: Defines the voltage reference value. For our newer boards (v1.8+ and AeroQuad32) you don't need to change the default value!
Parameter.Name: Voltage Reference

Parameter.Description: Defines the throttle value sent to the motors while idling. If your motors don't start spinning when armed, increase this values slowly. If they spin too fast, decrease it.
Parameter.Name: Minimum Armed (Idle) Throttle
